title: Medical Professional with Hearing Loss Seeking Amplified Stethoscope
chief_complaint: I need a stethoscope that will amplify breath, lung, and heart sounds to compensate for my hearing loss. I have also noticed a decrease in my hearing recently.

problem_summary.onset: Hearing loss detected 7 years ago; recent perceived decrease.
problem_summary.course: Stable for years, then recent decrease associated with vertigo episodes.
problem_summary.functional_impact: Inability to detect breath/lung and heart sounds during standard auscultation procedures required for her job as a nurse practitioner.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Primary goal is to find an amplified stethoscope solution for work.

history.present_illness: Patient is a nurse practitioner reporting difficulty with auscultation. She has a history of Ménière's disease. Vertigo is currently controlled.
history.otologic_history: Diagnosed with Ménière's disease 7 years ago at another facility.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Bilateral symmetrical moderate to moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss, flat in configuration.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: SRTs consistent with pure-tone findings. Word recognition scores indicate slight loss in ability to recognize speech.

history.present_illness: Follow-up for device selection and fitting.
history.patient_goals: Integration of hearing aids with stethoscope.

tests.name: Hearing Aid Fitting
tests.key_findings: Patient fit with bilateral RITE hearing instruments and a Bluetooth-enabled amplified stethoscope.

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient presents with a bilateral, symmetrical, moderate to moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss with a flat configuration. Speech recognition scores are good bilaterally (88% AD, 84% AS). Middle ear function is normal.
counseling_points: Your hearing loss affects more than just your job; bilateral hearing aids are recommended for daily communication, not just the stethoscope.
For auscultation, we need to ensure you can hear low-frequency sounds (breath/heart) which are often soft.
We can integrate an amplified stethoscope with hearing aids using Bluetooth streaming or a direct audio cable.
Using a stethoscope with RITE hearing aids allows you to keep the hearing aids in your ears while working.
notes_for_actor: You are a medical professional (Nurse Practitioner) and very focused on the specific task of using a stethoscope.
You may initially be resistant to or dismissive of the need for general hearing aids, focusing only on the work tool.
You are knowledgeable about medical terms but may not understand audiological technology integration (Bluetooth streamers).
